awd_titl_txt: Postdoctoral Research Fellowships in Plant Biology
awd_abstract_narration: Transposable elements were just discovered in maize by Dr.                      Barbara McClintock over 40 years ago.  She first genetically                    described the Ac-Ds system but there is still much that is not                  understood at the molecular level in this system.  Dr. Mary                     Honma, a Postdoctoral Fellow in Plant Biology, will characterize                                                                                                the behavior of these elements in tomato and Arabidopsis in the                 laboratory of Dr. Barbara Baker at the Gene Expression Laboratory                                                                                                                                                                               at Albany, California.                                                                                                                                          A successful completion of these studies will aid in the                        construction of genetic maps of tomato and Arabidopsis as well as                                                                                                                                                                               extending our insight into the characteristics of the Ac-Ds                     transposable element system.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE
